newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down in technical correction.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down in technical correction.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down in a technical correction Sunday on profit-taking ahead of Monday's settlement day, dealers said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index ended 6.04 points, or 0.40 percent, down at 1,486.33 after rising to 1,495.84 in early trading. Gainers led losers 138 to 126.

The technical correction was conspicuous in Dewan Salman Fibre, which rose sharply in the past few sessions, a dealer at Ali Hussain Rajabali said. The scrip closed 1.20 rupee lower at 34.80 after rising to 36.85 in early trade.
Overall sentiment was mixed, he said.
